sections.content: Electronics content demands clear visuals of tiny components, stable macro shots, and workspace coverage. Whether you're filming repairs, kit builds, or teardowns, viewers need to see what you're doing. Here's what successful electronics YouTubers use to make intricate work visible and engaging.

content.title: Overhead Camera
content.description: Bird's eye of workspace. Essential for soldering.

sections.title: Electronics Content Tips
content: Good lighting prevents shadows on work
Macro shots show detail viewers need

faq.question: Best camera for electronics work?
faq.answer: Any camera with good macro capability. Sony A6400 with macro lens popular. USB microscope for extreme detail. Overhead positioning matters more than camera brand.

faq.question: How to avoid reflections on components?
faq.answer: Diffused lighting from multiple angles. Avoid direct overhead light on shiny surfaces. Matte work surface helps. Adjust angles—test before starting project.

faq.question: USB microscope vs macro lens?
faq.answer: Both useful. Macro lens: better video quality, moderate magnification. USB microscope: extreme magnification, inspection-level detail. Many creators use both.

faq.question: Screen recording for oscilloscopes?
faq.answer: If digital scope with USB, capture directly. OBS for screen recording. Some scopes have video out. Photos of screen work for static measurements.
